Saying that GitHub needs to be decentralized is like saying that Coinbase needs to be decentralized... oh wait, that's *Bitcoin*. Git is already a distributed system.

It's Git hosting with a nice UI. Just like Coinbase is essentially Bitcoin wallet hosting with a nice UI. Both compromise decentralization for convenience - that doesn't mean you can't self-host. https://gitlab.com/  + https://bitbucket.org/  are also two popular alternatives

But we’re not talking about selling, only moving already owned Bitcoin off an exchange, like Coinbase, to a private wallet. How would outsiders even know this was happening?

The friction wouldn’t be felt until Coinbase started needing to tap into cold storage to complete the Bitcoin transfers. I don’t know what type of delay that would cause or how unusual it is. Long and unusual delays might cause panic, triggering others to sell? (2/2)

The more I think about it, the more impossible it seems to predict. Transferring already owned Bitcoin from Coinbase, for example, to a personal wallet, wouldn’t be a noticeable activity by outsiders. I’m assuming these type of transfers typically happen reasonably fast. (1/2)

We know exactly how much XRP that Ripple owns. They are abundantly transparent. Now, please show me how much Bitcoin and Ethereum is held by Coinbase and its investors. Regardless, owning a lot of XRP has no bearing on the XRP Ledger.
